intro: This level introduces what an Operating System is, its role between user and hardware, and basic types of operating systems.
points: Understand the position of OS as an interface between user programs and hardware.
Know basic OS functions: process management, memory management, file management, I/O device management.
Differentiate between system software and application software.
Recognize different types of OS: batch, time-sharing, multi-programming, multi-tasking, real-time.
Understand the concept of kernel and system calls at a basic level.
